iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Empowering Partner for Community Development. The project seeks to improve the capacity of a local partner in social work. Pakistan is one of the poorest countries in the world. Child labour is very common and large amounts of Pakistani children remain without basic education. Fida partners with the Assemblies of God (AOG) church of Peshawar in order to address the needs of the people in North West Pakistan. The project comprises of three main components: Community Health Education (CHE) in the local villages_ adult literacy classes and the establishment of a pre-school. Fida and AOG work together in the local communities_ which provide the partner with hands-on training in practical community development work. As the partnerâs capacities build up_ the social work the church does will improve. The CHE component will help the communities in becoming the main actors in their own development and the pre-school will provide the children with much-needed education. These elements together will contribute towards the overall improvement in life management and quality of life in the local communities.
iati-activity.sector: Multisector aid for basic social services

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: Tank Basic Health Care Work. Supporting Tank Hospital_s work with mother and child care systems_ health education_ family planning.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)

iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Islamabad

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The aim of this village school project in Punjab province is to cut down the use of child labour in the village, to improve children's health and educational standards, and to spread literacy. Apart from school teaching the project provides both health care and contraceptive advice for the children's families, especially the mothers.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The aim of the project is that the workers from the Textile and Home Based Women sectors specifically and from the other sectors in general will be better aware, organized and linked with the relevant institutions to improve their status and to eradicate poverty.

iati-activity.description: Earthquake relief: logistics

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / LambLamp School Project in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: Arrange the school and classrooms_ get high quality teaching material_ encourage the parents to send their children to school. Offer free education_ school clothes_ books and dealy meal.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Mainstreaming Child-Centred Disaster Risk Reduction. Capacity building on and mainstreaming of Disaster Risk Reduction in Plan and partner programmes_ as well as making communities more resilient to hazards. To mobilize communities_ especially children and youth_ to assess risks_ analyze the causes and come up with mitigation measures and preparedness plans

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Community Development. To improve the lives and the general health and sanitation conditions of vulnerable communities through the promotion of the community based health care and water and sanitation activities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: Appni Sehat - Our Health. Targeted to the growth of the prevention of HIV/AIDS and sexually transmitted diseases in Lahore for prostitutes, their customers and among the community. Also offer medical services for women prositutes and their families.

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Aid to Pakistan trough IOM
iati-activity.description: Support to IOM Humanitarian Assistance Programmes in Pakistan.

iati-activity.title: Reconstruction and Development in Pakistan's North West Frontier Regio
iati-activity.description: The Multidonor Trust Fund finances projects in Pakistanâs North West Frontier Region to (i) promote enhanced, sustainable and accountable delivery of basic services, including education, health, and administration of justice; (ii) support livelihoods and community-based development of basic infrastructure and services; (iii) support peace building activities and promote rapid crisis recovery; (iv) recover the destruction caused by the floats in the most affected provinces.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: The project Greening of Galiyat aims to provide the local population in and around 5-10 kms of Nathiagali an opportunity to develop commercial activity leading to job opportunities for a growing population. The development of fruit/fuel growing trees in the area is likely to influence large scale growing of fruit in the areas beyond the target area. The organisation will organise planting of 10 500 fruit trees and 10 000 fuel plants.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: The areas of activity in the Project are: juvenile justice; alternative care for children without family support; child labour; child abuse and exploitation; and children's right to participate and association.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: PIEDAR will implement a Project called "Centre for Environmental Education through Participatory Action Learning" (CEEPAL). A national network of schools is imparting environmental education through participatory action learning. The project also demonstrates values and shares knowledge for sustainable development in Pakistan and seeks to influence Government policies and practices for Environmental Education. Special attention is given to communicating climate change.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: The project "Awareness and prevention of HIV & AIDS among female sex workers" has been designed for awareness and prevention of HIV&AIDS among female sex workers in Sargodha and Iqbal Town in Lahore. The goal of the project is to create an enabling environment for empowerment of sex workers for protected sex and improved health-seeking behaviour leading to prevention of HIV& AIDS among sex workers and eunuchs. The objectives of the project is to promote the conditions that encourages sex workers and general community particularly the clients of sex workers to take steps to protect themselves against STIs and HIV infections and to provide affordable and accessible health facilities especially for female sex workers and children with focus on primary health care, reproductive health and STIs management.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: ROZAN will implement a Project called "Aangan - To reduce stigma around the issue of child sexual abuse by advocating, building capacity and raising awareness among individuals, professionals, institutions and organizations". The Aangan resource center aims to advocate more efficiently and effectively towards the formation of child protection and safety mechanisms and provide information to individuals regarding safe childhood, not only as a means of preventing children from child sexual abuse but also giving them an environment that ensures safety and enhances self-confidence. It also plans to build research as a necessary component, which would serve as a tool for advocating on the issues Aangan has been struggling with at either attitudinal level of individuals towards the issue or in bringing about a prominent and promising change in the child protection system.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: The project "HIV/AIDS Awareness Raising Programme for Population of Kalash Valleys and Additional Schemes" has been designed to create awareness and educate the communities of the three valleys on HIV/AIDS, STDs, Hepatitis B & C and TB. In addition the project includes five small additional schemes, e.g. building a school room and an irrigation channel, which cover other needs in the valleys.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: The project "Improving Thermal Efficiency of Buildings" will take place in Phunder Valley and Ishkoman Valley of Ghizar District in Gilgit-Baltistan and Mastuj Valley in Chitral District in NWFP. The Goal of the Project is to contribute to improve the socio-economic conditions of the poor people of the target communities through the installation of EE&HI products, contributing in reducing green house gases emission, ease pressure on local forests and improving health indicators through the provision of better habitat. The project also promotes gender equality.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: The project "Awareness and prevention of HIV & AIDS among vulnerable groups (FSWs, eunuchs and Youths)" has been designed for awareness and prevention of HIV&AIDS among these groups in Red light Area Lahore, Iqbal Town Lahore and Sargodha. The goal of the project is to create an enabling environment for empowerment of vulnerable groups for protected sex and improved health-seeking behaviour leading to prevention of HIV& AIDS among sex workers, youths and eunuchs. The objectives of the project is to promote the conditions that encourages sex workers, eunuchs and youths particularly the clients of sex workers to take steps to protect themselves from STIs and HIV infections and to provide affordable and accessible health facilities especially for female sex workers & their family members, eunuchs and youths with focus on reproductive health, STIs management and primary health care.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: Sanjog will implement a project called "Youth Empowerment Project" (YEP) in Quetta, Baluchistan. The project goal is to enable vulnerable children (male-female) of ethnic and religious minorities in particular, to combat all kinds of abuse and exploitation, substance abuse & STDs and to empower them for a socially and economically sound life. Major activities are capacity building of community organisations, awareness raising, life skills education, non-formal education, technical skill building and psycho-social counselling and medical aid.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Pakistan
iati-activity.description: Improving Thermal Efficiency of Buildings in Northern Pakistan. Improving the thermal efficiency in Phunder valley by offering energy efficient technologies and construction methids. Reducing use of wood and lowering the carbon dioxide.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Mainstreaming child-centred disaster risk management
